top_categories.workout_context: Rad Dirt Fest’s colorado rockies gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Rad Dirt Fest isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Rad Dirt Fest’s colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Rad Dirt Fest rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rad Dirt Fest when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Rad Dirt Fest — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Rad Dirt Fest’s 8,202ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rad Dirt Fest. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Rad Dirt Fest — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain.
Rad Dirt Fest’s colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Rad Dirt Fest intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Rad Dirt Fest’s 8,202ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rad Dirt Fest’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Rad Dirt Fest with 8,202ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (2,200-3,000 m); Thin air.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Rad Dirt Fest demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: colorado rockies gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%), high altitude (2,200-3,000 m). Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 62 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain in Salida, Colorado.
